safety_edibility_notes: Endangered species protected by international law. Poaching for traditional medicine and body parts is illegal and a major conservation threat.
safety_warning_text: Tigers are responsible for more human deaths than any other wild cat. Historical estimates suggest 100,000+ human deaths over past centuries. Sundarbans tigers are particularly known for human attacks.
safety_summary: Extremely dangerous apex predator. Tigers can and do prey on humans. All encounters with wild tigers should be avoided. Retreat slowly without turning your back if encountered.
safety_contraindications: Travel in groups in tiger territory
Make noise to alert tigers of presence
Face the tiger and back away slowly
encounter_protocol: Never turn your back on a tiger. Make yourself appear larger. Make noise. Back away slowly. Avoid direct eye contact. Never run.
legal_protection_status: CITES Appendix I, Endangered Species Act
